description: The Spa at Four Seasons Toronto is an urban escape located on the hotel’s ninth floor. Newly renovated, the Spa provides a relaxing experience from the moment you step out of the elevator. Treatments such as the Rose Gold Facial have been added highlighting the latest skin trends and with a focus on wellness. The 6ix Facial has also been designed specifically for men to rejuvenate their skin. Discover Toronto’s iconic Yorkville neighbourhood while looking out from the Spa’s outdoor terrace.

reviews.title: Go to spa in Toronto
text: The massage experience was unparalleled compared to any other spa. The massage therapist ensured I was completely relaxed and comfortable throughout the session. However, the pool area did not meet the usual high standards expected of a Four Seasons property; there were chairs cluttered with used towels and no guests utilizing them. We had to request drinks from the front desk since there was no server on deck. Apart from the pool area, everything else was exceptional. The changing rooms were well-equipped with everything you could possibly need. I would enthusiastically recommend the Four Seasons Spa for any occasion.

reviews.title: great services but profiling from staff left us disheartened
text: Had a lovely time and enjoyed our massage and facials up until the end of our visit. My mother was looking at a serum and put it back when the lady who was helping her walked away. When she came back, she looked at the shelf and then at my mother in shock, hastily looking for the serum on the shelf, asking my mother where she put it and if she could 'take it off of her hands for her', insinuating that she thought she still had it on her, when her hands were visibly empty. She had put it back in the wrong spot, and when the lady realized, she literally sighed of relief. We didn't realize that when you book the treatment and put your card information, they don't charge you automatically. The spa day was supposed to be a gift from my sister and I, and we didn't want our mother to know how much everything costed for that reason, so we left a note and specified them not to tell her, but the lady handed my mother the bill and gave her the bill breakdown still, even though we had left a note and specified that it was a gift and not to do that. My mother knew this was supposed to be a gift, so was a little taken back when they handed her the bill for that reason, and the same lady read into it that we couldn't afford to pay, and started asking questions insinuating that, such as 'is that okay?',  'we can split the payment if you need'. Overall, the services and amenities were great, but the profiling and behaviour from certain staff was a bit uncalled for.

reviews.title: Spa at Four Seasons - Pampering Options Galore
text: Towering over the vibrant Yorkville neighbourhood, the design-centric Four Seasons Hotel offers a melange of luxurious amenities enveloped in a sophisticated architectural setting. Accommodations are gorgeous, authentic French food authored by Chef Daniel Boulud is served, the hotel offers convenient access to designer shopping , museums, restaurants, all that Toronto has to offer.....and to relax the body, mind and soul after a hectic shopping spree...there is the Spa.

Ah....the Spa ...the Four Seasons Spa which features an indoor swimming pool, comfy lounge chairs,  whirlpool, sauna room, relaxation room,  massive spectacular change rooms and a high-tech gym with an adjoining yoga studio so I can do my 'sun salutation'......there is just a ton of wellness amenities here. The facility maintains the swanky demeanour of the hotel proper with it's lavish luxe aura and yet promotes an overall soothing ambience with its neutral tones. This vast wellness 'farm' weighs in at 30,000 sq. ft. (you can't feel claustrophobic here) embraces 16 treatment rooms including a luxury couples suite and a salon with hair, manicure, and pedicure stations. The roster of treatments is exhaustive with seemingly every imaginable kind of ritual available.....as with some fruity exotic treatments like the Ruby Red Grapefruit Scrub....sounds like breakfast to me. Being a spa novice, I choose my go-to treatment in the form of a massage......great stuff as I emerged from the session in a cloud-like state ready for life anew.
If you are a fan of the sport of Spa-ing......keen for the finest spa treatment and experience with therapists dedicated to guest services of the highest  standard .......
.....then try the ..........Spa at Four Seasons.......Pampering Options Galore

reviews.title: Not worth it! Go somewhere else
text: My husband and I haven’t had massages since the pandemic so we decided to treat ourselves.

Boy were we disappointed. There was NO water/tea/snack station anywhere!!! I understand they don’t want people touching water dispenser during covid, but at least leave water bottles around. I like to stay hydrated and was perched the whole time. The outdoor temperature this day was 30 feeling like 40 so we wanted to cool off in the pool but it was freezing! I was shivering for 5 minutes when I got out. The balcony seating area was noisy there was construction right above on the 10th floor, not relaxing we couldn’t lounge around like that for more than 5mins. They offered food orders off a QR menu. You have to pay for water! (Side note, we were shopping at Holt and they even had complimentary Flow water battle stations around the store and you don’t have to buy anything)!
Massage was $259.90 tax included per/person.

Massage was the only thing I enjoyed, sheets were really nice, and bed was comfortable because it was adjustable. I still feel that it was a rip off because spa experience was not worth it. I’d break it down that massage was $159.90, and use of shower was $100 lol. They even have the nerve to ask for tip.
I have been to over 30 spas and this spa is the worst. I will never come back and will discourage friends n family to go.

reviews.title: Our go to place in Toronto.
text: Very nice hotel with excellent service. The rooms are very well organized except for some of the corner suites that have a weird shaped bathrooms.

The food from room service is very good. The restaurant is noisy so we avoid it. We have eaten there once and the food was good but it’s too noisy to eat there regularly. The art in the restaurant is also not our taste but nice enough atmosphere overall otherwise.

This is the flagship Four Seasons hotel that replaced the classic original hotel in Yorkville. In some ways it is not as sweet as the old hotel but it is much more contemporary with very nice and efficient rooms. We have become used to it but we miss some of the charm of the old hotel.
One thing that is exceptional is the pool area. The pool and jacuzzi are great. The atmosphere is superb.
Overall I would recommend the hotel for rooms, location, pool area and service. It’s our choice when we visit Toronto.

reviews.title: Great rooms shady ground floor lobby
text: True to brand, this property has sumptuous rooms, great service, and decent food offering. Love their attention to personal needs especially for repeat guests. For woman traveling alone I have to say, the ground floor lobby bar has a shady crowd. I popped in for a quick dinner at check in. There was a huge scuffle with an unwanted guest that went out of control with yelling and hand cuffing. A man sitting next to me that I was barely civil to asked me if he could join me in my room....very creepy this never happened to me before. Sadly this bar seems to be drawing a certain type of characters. Would go back to this Four Seasons but avoid the bar all together and stick to second floor restaurants.

reviews.title: Super sp!!!
text: We spent time in the hot tub and swimming pool on our first day as we arrived at the hotel very early needless to say the room was not ready. There seemed to be several people there for the same reason. After a 14 hour flight we found this extremely refreshing. The area was clean and well maintained. The pool side menu is very limited tho. They do offer a larger menu, food ordered off this had to be eaten outside on the terrace. I understand the reasoning for this it does make sense but on a windy day it was not an inviting thought at all!

I did spend an afternoon in the spa. I had a wonderful time. The environment was spa perfect! The air conditioning was set at  the perfect temperature unlike so many spas that are way too Cold! The treatment was wonderful. The products used for a facial Smell good and really do make your skin glow! I did find it a bit of a rabbit Warren tho. There are no signs pointing you in the right direction on any of the doors - and there are many doors!. I had to ask an attendant how to get back to the locker area, I also got lost looking for the the shower!!

reviews.title: Walked in, walked out. Not for me.
text: I was looking for a nice place to unwind and use up company massage benefits. Thought I’d check this place out.

The pool is gorgeous, but there were lots of kids running free around it (looks like it’s the main hotel pool, so that’s expected.., but not spa-like). I asked if I could view the change room before booking (I like CLEAN) and was told no.
So no visit for me, and I’ll keep looking for a luxury spa experience and will post back when I find a nice one.

reviews.title: Wonderful
text: Best massage I’ve ever had gorgeous hotel spa and pool would highly recommend Unfortunaley could not order food or drinks in spa😒

reviews.title: Most beautiful spa in Toronto downtown!
text: From the moment reception greeted me to my departure, it truly was a five star hotel experience.  Fairly new hotel that was rebuilt so the hot tub is away from the pool and the steam room is inside the ladies room.  Massage rooms are beautiful...I could see George Clooney  or Brad Pitt having a massage there privately.  It's expensive but look for the seasonal specials and go during quiet times.

reviews.title: Tranquil day at the spa
text: Treated myself to a package retreat at the Four Seasons spa. I got a 60-min aromatherapy massage, 3-in-1 exfoliating facial, and pedicure. All the treatments I received were wonderful, but I would be most likely to go back for a massage. The RMT was very professional and made me feel so comfortable. Being able to customize your oil scent and ambient music was a nice touch and made for a really relaxing experience.
Although it can be quite expensive, I think it's definitely worth it (especially when you can take advantage of the pools, sauna, etc!)

reviews.title: Yorkville Zen
text: After a cold start to the fall a trip to spa is what the doctor ordered.  Having been to this spa multiple times, i had a chance to thoroughly enjoy all of the amenities and everything the spa has to offer.  Fantastic Massage, clean facilities, great pool and the right treats.

reviews.title: Good, but there are Better
text: I wrote about my experience on my personal blog, but I will also write it here.

I opted for a 60 minute Aromatherapy Massage followed by a 3-in-1 super Facial with Collagen Mask. I went early in the morning and it was pretty empty when I arrived. The lady at the reception kindly offered to take my coat, and I was introduced to this lovely spa attendant (whose name I cannot recall, but she was so sweet!) who showed me around the facility. Since I pretty much arrived when they first opened in the morning, I did not have time to use the hotel pool and hot tub BEFORE my session. I spent some time in the waiting room lounging on their curved chairs drinking tea before my massage.

Although the massage itself was relaxing, I wish more pressure could have been applied on my back. It seemed like the masseuse was just making long strokes along my back rather than applying pressure, and even though I asked for more pressure halfway through I didn’t feel particularly loosened up after the massage. The masseuse however, was extremely sweet and very accommodating to my music requests (I did ask her to change the music a few times)!

My facial was wonderful and my face was glowing after! The effect lasted days after, and I didn’t experience any breakouts or eczema, which is such a bonus because of my sensitive skin that often reacts when it gets in contact with incompatible products. If I were to choose between a massage and a facial here, I would pick a facial hands-down!

The spa has a co-ed lounging area with huge white sofas and where they offer water and magazines. By the time I was finished with my massage and facial, there was a lot of customers around. I wish it was a little quieter in there since there were some ladies chatting. Halfway through my spa experience, the same spa attendant from earlier came by to ask how everything was going for me. Talk about some 5-star service!

I also took a dip in their pool and hot tub. Their hot tub was soooo relaxing I stayed in there for QUITE a while, not giving a single care in the world that I was beginning to turn into a prune. I still felt sticky from the massage oils and went to take a shower in their beautiful shower room. Like any high end hotel spa, they use high-end skincare products and offer clean combs for each customer.

Overall, the facilities were clean and the staff were attentive. The facial was great, but the massage service was mediocre at best. The other thing I have to point out is the reception lady answering the phone who seemed a little bit rude when I called to make my appointment. There was also another time where I had to cancel an appointment made for someone else, and the reception lady interrupted me WHILE I was talking. For a spa located in a world-renowned hotel and with their price point, they should really be more aware of the little details. I really wouldn’t mind their prices IF their service was on par; however, I felt slightly underwhelmed. The spa is supposed to be a relaxing space from beginning to end, and the Spa at Four Seasons MOSTLY achieved that. Minus 1 star for the receptionist lady and minus 0.5 stars for the massage.

Would I come again? Probably not. Although I would certainly like to try out their scrubs or body wraps, there are other wonderful spas in Toronto that I have yet to experience (with professional receptionists and better massages) at a similar or better price point.
Rating: 3.5/5

reviews.title: Lovely tranquil spa and good massage
text: I was at the Four Seasons on business and decided to treat myself to a spa visit. The spa is absolutely beautiful. It was not busy on a Monday evening so the lounge areas were nice and quiet. You can grab a sauna while waiting for your treatment. It seems they run specials - I enjoyed the summer special aromatherapy massage. You can customize your experience (scents, music) which is a nice touch. It is expensive but I felt it was worth it! A nice treat!!

reviews.title: Amazing
text: Truly the best spa in Toronto. I got 3 treatments done and they were amazing. The staff exceeded my highest expectations in every way possible. Worth the splurge.

reviews.title: Best Spa in Toronto
text: I've been to every spa in Toronto and this is by far the best in terms of overall experience. I keep on coming back and I am never disappointed. I'm a bit of a spa fanatic and visit spas every time I travel; I travel often and mostly in Europe, where, needless to say, going to the spa has purpose, method, and rigour. The spa at the Four Seasons is the closest I can get to the European spa experience whenever I'm in Toronto.

The staff at the reception desk are always extremely helpful and friendly. Entering the lounge/change room area is always a pleasure. This area is spacious and comfortable. So many people complain about the cookies -- if you don't want them, just don't eat them?!?! I think it's ridiculous that some reviewers are basing their ratings with the "white flour" cookies as a major drawback of the spa. It's a minute detail that does not matter. The actual spa and spa experience makes up for this and goes well beyond in terms of attending to the minute details in all other categories.

I've tried a number of the services from hair to nails to massages, wraps, scrubs, facials. I do not have one complaint about any of the services I've received. The staff, attendants, and service providers have always ensured my comfort throughout my spa sessions. I really appreciate the sauna to use after (or between) services. I also LOVE the fact that the spa attendants don't EVER harass you to leave or anything like that. I like going to the spa alone for some "me" time and I don't really like talking to anyone in the process. And I never really have to. I've found peace and serenity at the Four Seasons Spa Toronto, and for this reason I will keep on coming back.

reviews.title: Amazing treatments and steam room
text: I have been to the spa twice and have really enjoyed both treatments. My sister and I went for massages. Highly recommend Nick and Fiona(massage therapists) We did have one issue and manager Corine was very helpful. Also had a facial from Raquel. Very good.

The eucalyptus steam room is amazing!! There is tea and fresh flavored water available as well as little cookies which I didn't try, they looked like shortbread There is a hot tub and pool in a co-ed area. It is the pool area for the hotel... It has a nice open and serene atmosphere.

reviews.title: Serene Enivronment
text: I went for an aromatherapy message and it was a fantastic overall experience. The treatment space is beautiful, calm, and relaxing. The pool area was fine, but the change rooms are probably the best part. Lots of spaces to relax in and an awesome steam room.

reviews.title: Back again
text: I live in this city and this is by far the best spa in the city.   The staff are exceptional and I go here at least once a quarter.   The views, the pool, the peace.   I have done couples massage here, facials and much more.  All exceptional experiences

reviews.title: One of the best spas in Toronto
text: You just can't beat a spa visit to the Four Seasons Spa. It's a nice escape from reality when you're not able to leave the city.

The front desk staff are always so welcoming as are the locker room attendants. The locker room is very relaxed with secure lockers, tea and snacks, and magazines. Fluffy robes and slippers are provided. It's lovely to sit back and relax before your services begin.

My favourite facial is 3 in 1 facial but they do not recommend it for pregnant women so I had the Gold Plumping facial during my last visit. It was very thorough and relaxing and included extractions. My face looked fresh and clean afterwards. It's a nice alternative, but will be going back to the 3 in 1 once I deliver.
The massages are always top notch with lovely oils to select from and a range of spa music to choose. Again, last visit I went with the pregnancy massage which uses unscented oil.
The showers are fully equipped with all the essentials so there is no need to bring anything.
If you're looking for a few hours to escape and relax this is the place to be. You won't want to leave.

reviews.title: First class Hotel
text: Charming, classy, respectful service provider. Wow experience. Winning customer experience. Made our children's wedding a delightful, joyous time. Excellent food and accommodations

reviews.title: Great facilities, excellent service
text: Spa day with the girls.  Excellent service all around....from the change room to the pool to the check in.  Excellent manicures (a special thank you to Liz who was fantastic).  VIP treatment all around.  Great experience. Would definitely return.

reviews.title: A birthday gift to remember!
text: I took my mom to the Spa Four Seasons for her birthday on a Monday. We had the most relaxing and incredible day. From the very beginning, the pleasant administrative staff gave us a warm welcome and wished my mom a happy birthday. They were very attentive to my requests - I ordered two glasses of champagne in between services and they were prompt to bring them on time, pleasantly surprising her.

Both of our massages were heavenly - we did the Aromatherapy massage, one of their signature services. This was by far the best massage I've received, and I've been to a number of well-known spas throughout the city in the last few years.

The facilities are everything you'd need to fall asleep, relax, read, or just zone out from the hectic world outside. This includes lounge area, whirlpool, pool, and steam room. We also noticed a very quick turnaround for towels, clean mugs, snacks, etc. throughout the day.
I am so thankful I chose Spa Four Seasons for my mom's special day - and would definitely return again!

reviews.title: Not worth it
text: No coed facilities

Nothing major was expecting something better than Ritz-Carlton but it was not. No sauna just steam. No whirlpool in change room. Massage nothing major and do not get any added enhancements to the treatment as it was not worth the $$$

reviews.title: This is one of my go to spas in the city
text: I’m pretty picky when it comes to spas and services, I don’t mind paying if I think it’s worth the trade off and my standards are high. I’ve been here about 5 time over the past few years and each time I have not been disappointed. It’s clean and inviting lots of space and the staff are super nice and helpful. Will definitely continue to go here. My favourite sport is the steam room and the times I have happen to go it hasn’t been busy so I love the fact that it’s often empty ! Great for in unwinding ! And newly renovated :)

reviews.title: Toronto's Top Spa Destination - even before the recent renovations
text: If you're a spa junkie or just simply looking to be pampered then a visit to the Four Seasons Spa is an absolute must! My great friend decided to take me for a much needed spa day for my birthday and we happened to book on the day of the spa re-opening after it being relocated for a number of months.

If you've been there before you might ask yourself why they needed to renovate. They didn't, but the new renovations did lend itself to a much larger and more welcoming reception area. Other than that, you won't notice much difference from before. It's still the modern, spacious retreat that it has always been.
The locker room/sitting area still has water, tea and fresh treats to enjoy while waiting for your services to begin or once they have ended.

I had a lovely facial performed by Julia. She was thorough and informative. My skin absolutely glowed after she was finished. She provided all the products used on an information card for my reference.

Sony gave a wonder pedicure and manicure. A Four Seasons pedicure is a must as there are hot towels throughout and a relaxing leg massage included. Tons of colour choice for the polish. The mani/pedi was much needed since I hadn't had either since I had given birth months earlier. Sony also surprised me with a cup cake for my birthday.
If you need a spa day, this is the place to go!

reviews.title: Love it
text: Ive been here a few times with my mom and alone, one of the best spas in toronto, tried massages and facials, they’re so professional and polite. The ambiance is great and relaxing. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a good spa around the Toronto area

reviews.title: Amazing
text: Lovely little spa with very clean facilities. I wish this place was close to home so I could go regularly. Great massages!

reviews.title: Amazing experience
text: This has been my second trip to the spa and it has been bliss each time. I have been to my share of spas in Toronto and this spa is by far the best. The attention to detail during your treatment is extraordinary and the facilities are calm, clean and simply a pleasure to enjoy. It is a bit of a splurge but it’s well worth it. Do not hesitate to try this spa and even save it for a special occasion as you will not be disappointed! Enjoy!

reviews.title: Splendid spa experience
text: The spa is elegantly designed, has all the luxury elements associated to the Four Seasons and has the most comfortable massage beds I have ever been on. The massage was excellent, with attention to every detail. The masseur adapted the massage and the temperature of the room to my liking. Overall, a great spa to visit and enjoy!

reviews.title: Construction noise
text: Love this facility but this visit was awful with the sound of condo construction.  I had to ask for the music to be turned up as much as possible to drown out the noise during my massage.

reviews.title: Elegant pampering
text: This was my first time to the Spa Four Seasons. I was there with my husband and 2 adult children. The facilities are absolutely beautiful. Very clean and high quality. I had a great massage. The therapist really listened to my requests. It is a great location to visit with members of your own gender as the relaxation lounges and the steam rooms are found within the change rooms. There is shared space in the gorgeous pool area that has an amazing hot tub though.

reviews.title: Beautiful space but disappointing experience
text: I will preface my review by saying that the spa itself is beautiful, and what you would expect from a Four Seasons product. I was disappointed, however, on several occasions during my visit. The ladies at the front reception were kind and warm, as was the lady who escorted me to meet my massage therapist after showing me the facilities. This is where my experience began to sour. My therapist was very passive aggressive, and upon meeting me said, in a very curt manner, “you didn’t answer me when I said your name so I didn’t know if you were (insert my name here)”. I was pretty appalled by this, as we were the only ones in the area and the lady who gave the tour was escorting me directly to the therapist. Additionally, I never once heard her say my name so when she came back with the snarky comment of “you didn’t answer me” I was pretty taken aback. Okay, whatever, moving on. We go into the room and the massage starts. All is well. Until sirens start blaring. The room was not sound proof and every passing emergency vehicle could be heard along with car horns. Not what I expect from such an esteemed brand. Obviously they can’t control what’s going on outside but I would have hoped for more sound proofing. My friend and I used the pools and hot tub after our massages. Warning - the pool is shared with hotel guests and there were many children jumping and splashing about (it was Christmas, so probably busier than usual. I have kids so it didn’t both me but it may have interfered with other guests relaxation time). The final straw was when we went to pay for our massages. We asked for receipts for insurance purposes (we had specified this weeks prior when the massages were booked). my Friend and I were both given a receipt with the same massage therapists name -  and neither of us had this therapist do our massage! We took this to mean that our therapists were not registered and thus would not be covered by insurance. This seemed fishy and shady to us and left us feeling as though the spa was being somewhat fraudulent with their dealings. Again, totally not what I expected from a 5-star facility. If I could I would give 3.5 stars, but since I can’t, 3 will do as I do not find the experience worthy of 4 stars.

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
text: Surprised my boyfriend with a couples massage for his birthday. The entire booking process was seamless and easy. Upon arrival, we were greeted immediately and shown to our respective change rooms. The massages were amazing, as well as all of the facilities. The only downside is that the only co-ed area is the pool. Regardless of that, it was such an amazing experience and would highly recommend going during the week as it was not busy.

reviews.title: Warm Service
text: I went to the Four Seasons Spa for a girls day with my sisters, mom and aunt.  It was a Christmas gift for both my mom and aunt, as well as a birthday celebration for one of my sisters.  The entire booking process was seamless and the customer service from the spa reception team was awesome.  We were able to book all of our treatments around the same time block and discretely pre-pay with gratuities our services for my family.

I booked the Aromatherapy massage, which was the second time receiving this service at this spa.  It did not disappoint - both times I have had wonderful RMT's, unfortunately I cannot remember of the name of the gentleman from the first appointment.  Yesterday my RMT was Josef, who provided amazing service.  I mentioned at the beginning of the treatment that I was getting over bronchitis and he was kind enough to get me a glass of water in case it was needed during the service.  Before you start the treatment you get to choose between four different essential oils related to the four seasons for your massage.  I chose autumn which was a mix of mint, rosemary and vanilla essential oils (smells amazing).  The massage was amazing and I felt a million times better afterwards.  You can really tell that their staff care about providing 5 star service in all aspects.

The facilities itself are also beautiful, warm and welcoming.  We used the steam room post-massage and it is a proper steam room.  I have been to other spas where the doors never were quite sealed right or the correct temperature.  The relaxation room is comfortable and stocked with teas and some small bites.  The lockers were also super tidy and the staff maintaining them were super helpful, friendly.
I have only had a massage here, but would like to return for some of their other services.  My sister and aunt had the elements facial, which they both loved - their skin looked amazing too.
I will definitely be returning to this spa again!

reviews.title: What you would expect from the Four Seasons!
text: Such a beautiful experience!  As soon as I walked through the beautiful spa entrance, I felt less stressed.  I was greeted promptly and offered a specialty drink and snack.  I was then taken to the change room.   It had been awhile since my last visit, so I was given a tour.  The locker attendant was so nice.  Once I had my locker, I slipped into the luxurious robe.  It was like wearing a cloud.  I had the LTB facial.  I loved the facial.  I left feeling refreshed and looking dewy (thanks so much Victoria)!
Thank you Four Seasons and Victoria...you really know how to make a girl feel special!

reviews.title: Beautiful spa
text: Located in Yorkville in the four seasons hotel on the 9th floor. The spa is lovely. After checking in at the reception area, hubby and I were guided to our respective change rooms. Nice and clean with lockers, sofa area, tea, water and snack area (with vegan treats...yay!), washrooms, showers, make up counters, steam room, and a lounge area with reclined “beds” to wait for your treatment.
My RMT came and got me and took me to the couple’s massage room where hubby also arrived.

We had a little info from the RMTs then received a 90 minute couple’s bamboo massage. It was quite nice and ended with a nice ginger drink, maple candy and mini cupcakes (that hubby ate as they were not gf).
We stayed to use the hot tub, pool and loungers. It was a pretty big area but noisy as several families with children were enjoying to pool too (guests of the hotel).

We then showered and changed in the change rooms. All toiletries, towels, combs, brushes and hair dryers were available. My only suggestion is there should be an “occupied” sign at the showers when in use. It was fairly easy to tell the glass door showers were in use, but not so for the curtained shower.
Beautiful spa but ridiculously expensive. $325 for a 90 minute massage PLUS tax and tip😳

reviews.title: Chantel & Julia ~ The Dynamic Duo!
text: My maternity leave was ending so my wonderful partner sent me on a spa day for a massage and facial before I had to head back to work.
As always, the facilities were immaculate and the staff was exceptional. I arrived early so that I could enjoy the hot tub, sauna and pool deck. It was a nice quiet Wednesday morning.

My visit started off with a fabulous massage by Chantel. This lady has firm, magic hands. She had done my pregnancy massage about a year earlier and she was as lovely as I had remembered. I should have booked 90 minutes instead of 60 minutes!

After my massage, Julia greeted me for a thorough facial. I was happy that I had been booked in with her as she does a great job with extractions and always has my skin glowing at the end of the visit.
I'm looking forward to my next visit. I would recommend taking a day off work to go on the weekday when it's much quieter. I'll definitely be booking with both these ladies.
I do wish you could order lunch to eat by the pool instead of having to get dressed and head down to one of the restaurants.

Also, there was some confusion at the end of my visit about the method of payment. My partner had pre-paid for the visit, however the lady checking me out assured me this wasn't the case and I had to present my credit card. While I was downstairs having lunch, my partner called in and they found the already paid for gift card on file that he had purchased in advance. I had told them this and this is the second time this has happened. It's a bit of a stressful event to have happen at the end of a relaxing visit. Obviously, this wasn't a one of situation since this has been twice in a row now. I then had to go back upstairs after I spoke with him to ensure I had been refunded. They knew I was down at the D Bar so it would have been a nice touch for them to send the message down that I didn't need to head back up to see if this had been rectified.

reviews.title: Lovely experience
text: I work for a small business and our company took us for the Elemental Massage and Element Facial. The waiting room was nice. The massage therapist was very professional. She explained the massage we had booked was different than a typical massage and I could switch if I wanted. I appreciated her intro description as the massage was certainly different but I quite enjoyed it. I think her explanation in advance really helped me be more relaxed. The oil and scent was one of the nicest I have had for a massage, so great!

The facial was very lovely and left my skin feeling fresh. Overall it was a lovely and professional experience. The spa pool is one of the nicest spa pools I have seen for a toronto spa, or in door spa! It is nicely integrated with couches and outdoor seating. Beats the pool at Toronto’s Ritz!!!
A few cons:

-when I entered I asked the doorman how to get to the spa. He said 9th floor guest elevator but didn’t elaborate.  I tried to take the first elevator I saw and turns out wasn’t the right one. I’m normally not this picky but would have expected a better flow and service at four seasons
-robes- too heavy for summer and too small (I’m a medium and felt too small like I was going to expose myself)
-snacks (a couple options which were tasty but below par, the Ritz has much better snacks and in fact massage tables)

Overall it was a lovely experience!  That said, in my view, you really need to use the facilities and enjoy the steam room, pool etc to make the cost worth it. If you just want a facial or massage without the experience it is not worth the cost in my view!!!!

reviews.title: Spa review mostly
text: Well I only come for the spa but have stayed for dinner and also drinks at DBar.  It's a lovely spot and although the spa is not inexpensive, it is quite nice and you can linger for a long time on the patio deck (covered). or lounge by the indoor pool.
Hotel is happening and a great place to be.
